function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Nurse managers and healthcare personnel being exposed to covid-19 in the hospital environment","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overwhelmed healthcare system due to pandemic management challenges","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Purposive sampling technique used to select diverse participants may not fully represent the population and lead to biased results.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Direct communication and in-person interviews may increase the risk of disease transmission between researchers and participants.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Data collection conducted during the pandemic may be influenced by the rapidly evolving nature of the situation, leading to time-dependent biases.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Risk of data contamination due to potential exposure to infectious agents","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential impact on public health due to unmitigated disease transmission in hospital settings","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of covid-19 crisis management plan in the healthcare setting","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Psychological problems among nursing staff","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of covid-19 crisis management plan","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Absenteeism and presenteeism among nurses","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Infection among nurses","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Fear of infection leading to panic emotions, anxiety, and depression","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient nursing knowledge about the coronavirus","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Nursing shortage due to the covid-19 pandemic crisis","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate hospital preparation for the coronavirus pandemic","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate infection control measures for medical staff and patients","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of proper equipment in ambulances and morgues for infection control","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of adequate training and education for healthcare teams on dealing with covid-19","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Multiple zones in the hospital may lead to cross-contamination if not managed effectively.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate communication and collaboration may lead to confusion and errors in patient care.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of effective communication and collaboration among healthcare professionals","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate access to preventive supplies and antiseptics","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of support for isolated workers and those with chronic diseases","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate supply of preventive supplies and antiseptics","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of monitoring and surveillance in isolation hospitals","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shortage of nursing staff due to fear of infection and lack of clear plan for dealing with covid-19 pandemic","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Absence of nursing staff due to transportation challenges and curfew restrictions","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased working hours and vacation time for nurses","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Psychological problems such as panic, fear, anxiety, and depression among staff nurses","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Global misinformation and the ’infodemic’","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of preparation to deal with psychological problems","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of emphasis on the psychological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient supply of personal protective equipment ppe","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate availability of personal risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of communication and collaboration between nurses and physicians in a civil environment","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate material support for healthcare workers","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited scope of study with focus on nursing managers only","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Challenges in crisis management during covid-19 pandemic","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Fear of infection leading to absenteeism among
